title: I.-A Fragment of a Work of Pierius on the First Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians.
author: Pierius of Alexandria

paragraphs.text: I.-A Fragment of a Work of Pierius on the First Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians.

Origen, Dionysius, Pierius, Eusebius of Caesareia, Didymus, and Apollinaris, have interpreted this epistle most copiously;[fn-28-P2819_743260:2-nf] of whom Pierius, when he was expounding and unfolding the meaning of the apostle, and purposed to explain the words. For I would that all men were even as I myself,[fn-28-P2820_743439:3-nf] added this remark: In saying this, Paul, without disguise, preaches celibacy.[fn-28-P2821_743535:4-nf]

references.text: No doubt he does, as did his Master, Christ, before him, and under the same limitations. Matt. xix. 12.
